page.title: 12Employment,Travel
page.content: Approx one third of the total population are in paid employment with an unusually high proportion (25%) being employed in agriculture.There are three working farms in the village of Kynnersley itself with two more outlying farms in the parish.Over 70% of the working population are employed in the tertiary sector with clerical secretarial,retail and education occupations being well represented. In the village there is a plumbing firm,a joiner and vehicle bodybuilder and a nursing home.Many of the workforce commute to work in nearby Towns.Commuters travel by private transport,over 80% by car as the bus service only goes to Wellington and is too infrequent.Most agricultural workers walk or cycle to work.A full time Gamekeeper is employed by Eyton Estates.
